turns.speaker: POTTER
turns.text: Not that it makes any difference to me, but why did you come to me? Why don't you go to Sam Wainwright and ask him for the money?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't get hold of him. He's in Europe.

turns.speaker: POTTER
turns.text: Well, what about all your other friends?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: They don't have that kind of money, Mr. Potter. You know that. You're the only one in town that can help me.

turns.speaker: POTTER
turns.text: I see. I've suddenly become quite important. What kind of security would I have, George? Have you got any stocks?

turns.speaker: POTTER
turns.text: Yes . . . how much is your equity in it?

turns.speaker: SAM'S VOICE
turns.text: I have a big deal coming up that's going to make us all rich. George, you remember that night in Martini's bar when you told me you read someplace about making plastics out of soybeans?

turns.speaker: SAM'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, Dad's snapped up the idea. He's going to build a factory outside of Rochester. How do you like that?

turns.speaker: SAM'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, why not? Can you think of anything better?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know . . . why not right here? You remember that old tool and machinery works? You tell your father he can get that for a song. And all the labor he wants, too. Half the town was thrown out of work when they closed down.

turns.speaker: SAM'S VOICE
turns.text: That so? Well, I'll tell him. Hey, that sounds great! Oh, baby, I knew you'd come through. Now, here's the point. Mary, Mary, you're in on this too. Now listen. Have you got any money?

turns.speaker: SAM'S VOICE
turns.text: Well, now listen. I want you to put every cent you've got into our stock, you hear? And George, I may have a job for you; that is, unless you're still married to that broken-down Building and Loan. This is the biggest thing since radio, and I'm letting you in on the ground floor. Oh, Mary . . . Mary . . .

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You don't like coconuts! Say, brainless, don't you know where coconuts come from? Lookit here  from Tahiti  Fiji Islands, the Coral Sea!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: A new magazine! I never saw it before.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Of course you never. Only us explorers can get it. I've been nominated for membership in the National Geographic Society.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Hello. You look at me as if you didn't know me.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You've passed me on the street almost every day.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Uh-uh. That was a little girl named Mary Hatch. That wasn't you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm not very good at this.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hot dog! Just like an organ.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Do I look as funny as you do?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I guess I'm not quite the football type. You . . . look wonderful. You know, if it wasn't me talking I'd say you were the prettiest girl in town.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Well, why don't you say it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe I will say it. How old are you anyway?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Eighteen? Why, it was only last year you were seventeen.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, no. Just right. Your age fits you. Yes, sir, you look a little older without your clothes on.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Okay, then, I'll throw a rock at the old Granville house.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, no, don't. I love that old house.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, no, George, don't. It's full of romance, that old place. I'd like to live in it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I wouldn't live in it as a ghost. Now watch . . . right on the second floor there.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, not just one wish. A whole hatful, Mary. I know what I'm going to do tomorrow and the next day and the next year and the year after that. I'm shaking the dust of this crummy little town off my feet and I'm going to see the world. Italy, Greece, the Parthenon, the Colosseum. Then I'm coming back here and go to college and see what they know . . . and then I'm going to build things. I'm gonna build air fields. I'm gonna build skyscrapers a hundred stories high. I'm gonna build bridges a mile long . . .

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: If I told you it might not come true.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What is it you want, Mary? What do you want? You want the moon? Just say . . .

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'll take it. And then what?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, then you could swallow it and it'd all dissolve, see? And the moonbeams'd shoot out of your fingers and your toes, and the ends of your hair.  Am I talking too much?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Gesundheit. This requires a little thought here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: They're way downtown. They'd be on my side, too.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hello, Mary. I just happened to be passing by.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yeah, so I noticed. Have you made up your mind?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Have you made up your mind?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: About coming in. Your mother just phoned and said you were on your way over to pay me a visit.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My mother just called you? Well, how did she know?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I didn't tell anybody. I just went for a walk and happened to be passing by . . .

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Well, are you coming in or aren't you?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, I'll come in for a minute, but I didn't tell anybody I was coming over here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's all right. I thought you'd go back to New York like Sam and Ingie, and the rest of them.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, I worked there for a couple of vacations, but I don't know . . . I guess I was homesick.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: All right, for a minute. I still can't understand it though. You know I didn't tell anybody I was coming here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, I don't want to be rude.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, I see it still smells like pine needles in here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh . . . yeah, yeah. That's all right.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, of course I like her. She's a peach.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, it's just marriage in general you're not enthusiastic about, huh?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, marriage is all right for Harry, and Marty, and Sam and you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Where are we going?  Look at this. There's the kitty, Ernie. Here, come on, count it, Mary.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I feel like a bootlegger's wife.  Look!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You know what we're going to do? We're going to shoot the works. A whole week in New York. A whole week in Bermuda. The highest hotels  the oldest champagne  the richest caviar  the hottest music, and the prettiest wife!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll be back in a minute, Mary.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Remember the night we broke the windows in this old house? This is what I wished for.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mary Hatch, why in the world did you ever marry a guy like me?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: To keep from being an old maid.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You could have married Sam Wainwright or anybody else in town.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I didn't want to marry anybody else in town. I want my baby to look like you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You didn't even have a honeymoon. I promised you . . .  . . . Your what?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Lassos the stork! You mean you . . . What is it, a boy or a girl?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Zuzu! What's the matter with Zuzu?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, she's got a cold. She's in bed. Caught it coming home from school. They gave her a flower for a prize and she didn't want to crush it so she didn't button up her coat.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What is it, a sore throat or what?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Just a cold. The doctor says it's nothing serious.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The doctor? Was the doctor here?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes, I called him right away. He says it's nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Is she running a temperature? What is it?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Just a teensie one  ninety-nine, six. She'll be all right.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: George, darling! Where have you been?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mary! Let me touch you! Oh, you're real!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You have no idea what's happened to me.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You have no idea what happened . . .

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, you two idiots! George, sit down and have dinner.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, aren't you going to finish dressing for your graduation party? Look at you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't care. It's George's tux.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Pop, can I have the car? I'm going to take over a lot of plates and things.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, Mom  I'm chairman of the eats committee and we only need a couple of dozen.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, no you don't. Harry, now, not my best Haviland.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Put those things in the car and I'll get your tie and studs together.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Okay, Mom. You coming later? You coming later, George?

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Well, aren't you going to make a deposit?

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Well, then . . it's usually customary to bring the money with you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: With butter, if they got any....

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: When do we get to the lighthouse?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I can't wait to get there.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sure you do -- you win either way.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Low tide at Cable Junction is 7:46 p.m.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What'd you do?  Memorize the tide tables?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I can't help it  it sticks in my mind.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sean!  Listen!  Listen to me, Sean.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Bring her to port a little.  That's it -- steady.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I think we're changing course a little.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Is she responsible for the punch?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Who's that?  Quick -- I'm in love.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: If you're beached, why are we doing this?  For practice?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Then why are we futzing around the dock?  We can make a few bucks working at the beach.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I could give you a dozen good reasons.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay, okay, don't say I didn't remind you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Your dad must be really pissed.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's not going to be easy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Putz -- that won't be for hours.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: They're okay, if they got little white canes and tin cups.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What the hell.  Did your mom put all this together?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Same as always -- glub-glub, bubble-bubble, stroke-stroke. There sure is some weird shit on the bottom of the ocean.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Mostly old garbage.  Today we found a '48 Hudson.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Over here.  I want you to meet somebody.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No big thing, we'll see who's out there, maybe picnic.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh, out a ways.  Maybe the lighthouse.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Goddamn it, Sean, you listen to me or I will kick your ass, do you hear me?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: We're throwing a rope and you better catch it, hear?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: But we had it!  We were headed right for it!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Like hell!  We're on the starboard tack!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You're betting what you already got.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: As soon as you get us on the island, you got to call in.  My dad's the mayor....

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: What the hell, we're steering for it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I thought you said she was going with us?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: How're we going to do that floating on this garbage...?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Anyone got another set of sails?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Can you get us a line?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Chief Brody -- can we go?  Please?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: It's okay, it's okay.  What's the matter?  Tina?  Honey?  Hey ---

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Till noon.  This is on my own time.  Hi, Shorty.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Then check it out.  I'll be in the office.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Hendricks.  I want to go over your reports and your Form 908.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I just made it up.  It means, "Get me out of there."  What the hell's that?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Diver's camera.  Tom Andrews brought it up from under that abandoned cruiser.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Abandoned?  It's a little early in the season for that.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Rich people.  Home port is Newport, Rhode Island.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: If I had a $100,000 boat, I sure as hell wouldn't leave it anchored alone in the channel.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: If you had a $100,000 boat there'd be an investigation.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: We got a helluva tide this month.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Could you just keep that crowd back, please?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: I missed you at the funeral home. Santos said you were here.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You didn't miss much.  Christ, what a mess.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The woman passenger on the boat that blew up.
